poem:
Atafona's Retreat  

The sea devours  
Dunes once kissed  
Oranges whispered  
In the breeze,  
Sônia watches  
Through salt-seared windows—  
Time's restless tide  
Trace patterns  
On memories,  
Her house, a fleeting  
Pause,  
Vanished beneath  
The sweeping embrace  
Of ocean's forgetting pulse,  
Where childhood summers  
Are tender ghosts  
Dancing on the surf's edge.
